div1.p: Reed consoles Blincoe after her husband's death.

div1.head: Letter from Walter Reed to Laura Reed Blincoe, September 22, 1889
div1.p:
I have
just seen learned in the Advocate
an account of Mr Blincoe's
sudden death and I hasten
to tell you how inexpressi=
bly shocked & grieved we
are to learn of it- How
sudden! how dreadful! but
God knoweth best, my
darling Sister, & we should
try to bow in meekness
to his sovereign will-
I know how feeble words
are under such circum=
stances, but we want
you to know that our
hearts go out to you
and yours in this hour of
great sadness. Please
write & tell me just how
you are situated, what
your circumstances are
& what your plans are
for the future- I thank
God that you have,
at least, a good home
in Ashland- Please write
soon - all send warmest
love- In haste,
